no-default-rc.description: prevent Yarn from automatically detecting yarnrc and npmrc files
no-default-rc.name: no-default-rc

use-yarnrc.description: specifies a yarnrc file that Yarn should use (.yarnrc only, not .npmrc)
use-yarnrc.name: use-yarnrc

verbose.description: output verbose messages on internal operations
verbose.name: verbose

offline.description: trigger an error if any required dependencies are not available in local cache
offline.name: offline

prefer-offline.description: use network only if dependencies are not available in local cache
prefer-offline.name: prefer-offline

json.descriptions: format Yarn log messages as lines of JSON (see jsonlines.org)
json.name: json

har.descriptions: save HAR output of network traffic
har.name: har

force.descriptions: install and build packages even if they were built before, overwrite lockfile
force.name: force

skip-integrity-check.descriptions: run install without checking if node_modules is installed
skip-integrity-check.name: skip-integrity-check

check-files.descriptions: install will verify file tree of packages for consistency
check-files.name: check-files

no-bin-links.descriptions: don't generate bin links when setting up packages
no-bin-links.name: no-bin-links

flat.descriptions: only allow one version of a package
flat.name: flat

no-lockfile.description: don't read or generate a lockfile
no-lockfile.name: no-lockfile

frozen-lockfile.description: don't generate a lockfile and fail if an update is needed
frozen-lockfile.name: frozen-lockfile

update-checksums.description: update package checksums from current repository
update-checksums.name: update-checksums

link-duplicates.description: create hardlinks to the repeated modules in node_modules
link-duplicates.name: link-duplicates

link-folder.description: specify a custom folder to store global links
link-folder.name: link-folder

global-folder.description: specify a custom folder to store global packages
global-folder.name: global-folder

modules-folder.description: rather than installing modules into the node_modules folder relative to the cwd, output them here
modules-folder.name: modules-folder

preferred-cache-folder.description: specify a custom folder to store the yarn cache if possible
preferred-cache-folder.name: preferred-cache-folder

cache-folder.description: specify a custom folder that must be used to store the yarn cache
cache-folder.name: cache-folder

mutex.description: use a mutex to ensure only one yarn instance is executing
mutex.name: mutex

silent.description: skip Yarn console logs, other types of logs (script output) will be printed
silent.name: silent

network-concurrency.description: maximum number of concurrent network requests
network-concurrency.name: network-concurrency

no-scripts-prepend-node-path.description: don't prepend the node executable dir to the PATH in scripts
no-scripts-prepend-node-path.name: no-scripts-prepend-node-path

no-node-version-check.description: do not warn when using a potentially unsupported Node version
no-node-version-check.name: no-node-version-check

focus.description: Focus on a single workspace by installing remote copies of its sibling workspaces
focus.name: focus

otp.description: one-time password for two factor authentication
otp.name: otp
